title: A King Without A Kingdom
opening: Though preparations are still being made to raise troops for the resistance army at Garreg Mach, the Imperial army is already one step ahead. Anticipating the resistance army's actions, General Randolph and the Imperial vanguard under his command begin their advance towards Garreg Mach to reclaim the monastery.
Fulfilling a promise made five years ago, your former students gather once more at the monastery, as do the knights. However, your joyful reunion is cut short...

dialogue.speaker: Alois
dialogue.line: Ah, thank the goddess... I couldn't bear the thought of letting Jeralt down by not finding you.

dialogue.speaker: Shamir
dialogue.line: Guess you lucked out.

dialogue.speaker: Catherine
dialogue.line: We've been looking everywhere for you! But...I see Lady Rhea isn't with you. Damn.

dialogue.speaker: Cyril
dialogue.line: Everyone was real worried about you, Professor.

dialogue.speaker: Hanneman
dialogue.line: Seteth has told us everything. From here on out, you will have our aid.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I am so grateful that everyone is safe. I am sorry things are moving so rapidly, but there is something we must discuss. Come with me.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: The time has come to make our true stand against the Empire.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Let's win, no matter what.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Let's all work together.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I don't feel confident, but we'll do our best.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Our base will be Garreg Mach Monastery. The interior is in less than pristine condition, but we should be able to utilize it much the same as we had before.

dialogue.speaker: Catherine
dialogue.line: Surely those Imperial jerks have this place staked out, right? It's a highly strategic location.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: It may be an area of importance, but it is far removed from the front lines. Considering the burden of transport, it is possible they are not paying too much attention to it.

dialogue.speaker: Shamir
dialogue.line: Nothing escapes the emperor. There must be at least a spy or two.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Professor, what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I have no objections.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: I see! Then it must be the right idea!

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I'm worried about supplies.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Your concern is valid. However...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: The town and surrounding hamlets are still present, and though far from abundant, the church still has funds at its disposal.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: That's true... Professor, I think we can leave expanding our army to my brother. He was always good at negotiating, and I believe he is best suited to the task.

dialogue.speaker: Ferdinand
dialogue.line: In that case, I have a request. Please allow my soldiers to join your ranks as well. House Aegir already tried taking on the emperor. As a result, our territory was stolen from us. As a consequence, I do not have many soldiers left to speak of. But those I have are yours to command.

dialogue.speaker: Dorothea
dialogue.line: I feel like I should tell you that I've been protecting some kids who lost their parents in the war. They're in the town right now, but maybe we can move them to the monastery? I'm sure they'd be happy to chip in however they can.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Hm... Yes, I understand. I will make the necessary arrangements.

dialogue.speaker: Linhardt
dialogue.line: I nabbed some valuables from my house. Father is with the emperor now, so... It's not much, but it's yours.

dialogue.speaker: Bernadetta
dialogue.line: I don't have a thing to contribute. In fact, I'm still in my same old clothes!

dialogue.speaker: Caspar
dialogue.line: I've been wandering on my own for five years. I won't go back to that house or my father, that's for sure!

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I understand. Leave it to me. No labor is too great if it means saving Fódlan...

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: I have lost my dominion. My nobility may seem like nothing more that a title. But I will never lose my noble heart. I will stop Edelgard, even if it costs me my life. I have turned my blade against her now. I cannot go back on that decision. Professor... Do you think I chose the wrong path?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Not at all.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: You are right...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll find out soon enough.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: You are right...

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: The promise was made five years ago, but I must say I'm rather impressed by how many of us managed to make it. Personally, I only showed up because I hoped to see you again, Professor. I've been with my family in the Empire until recently. I admit to feeling a little guilty betraying Her Majesty...but only a little. Now that we're all together again, I suppose the fighting will begin soon.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! You won't believe what happened! I figured I couldn't go back to the Empire after Garreg Mach fell, so I started drifting across the Kingdom and the Alliance. Then I just happened to run into our old class, so we came back to the monastery together!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Ah, at last, I return to my domain! My lonely paradise! My realm of exquisite solitude! Huh? Professor? Is that, um. Is that you? You, um. You didn't hear that just now, did you?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Sorry.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Oh! Forget you heard anything!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Hear what?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Right. You didn't? Well, um. Good.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be...difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means that common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will...ah, will turn. I have certainty.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: A country with no king has no future. That's why I made my way here. Professor, don't let me down.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Country with no king?

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Hmph. You'll understand soon enough.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's forge ahead.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Yes, let's. Find me a worthy opponent to battle, and I'll be content.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I left home without telling my father. Did you know that? I can just imagine my father's face contorted in anger and the delightful words he must have used to describe me. Kind of a scary image, actually. But regardless, I've put my faith in you, Professor. And I'm hoping I haven't made a big mistake.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Hey, Professor. It's been a while. It's really good to see you again. Gorgeous as ever, might I add. An awful lot has happened in these past five years. There were so many times I wished you were around. I'm glad you're back. Your skills are worth more than a whole army.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: You're here, Professor, along with everyone from our old class. It's like we've gone back in time! When I think that I'll be around you again, all of my sorrows just drift away.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Frankly, I don't feel too happy.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Hmm, I understand. Especially with Lady Rhea missing... It sounds like the Kingdom and Alliance have been in a sorry state too. But we can't let that get us down!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's do our best together.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Hmm, yes. I'll at least try not to hold anyone back.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Let's work together for the common good, like we did five years ago!

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Members of the knights tell me that Father left their ranks five years ago. They say he announced he was returning to the Kingdom, but nobody's heard from him since. I haven't received word that he went back home to Mother... Where could he be... Where are you, Father...

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Professor, I have a proposal. Why not go beyond the Knights of Seiros--instead, uniting with allies from all across Fódlan to fight for our cause? Looking back, it would have been best to ally with the Kingdom and join forces against the Empire. But now the Kingdom is not exactly... Well...

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Fighting alongside you and everyone else is a dream come true, Professor! And don't worry about my little sis. Right now she's back home helping out with the family business. I kinda figured I was gonna be stuck going back and taking over for her. But thanks to you guys, I get to work on my dream of becoming a proper knight!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: It's been fixed up quite a bit, but its battle scars aren't so easily erased... To think that a glorious cathedral, with a thousand year history...would end up like this. I'll rebuild this place someday. This cathedral is the symbol of Fódlan. Maybe I should paint a picture of the beautiful cathedral of old, while I still remember what it looked like...

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I've grown weary and impatient--these past five years, my hands have been bound. But now, I can finally take action with a clear goal. I'm grateful to you and to everyone.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I didn't do anything.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Nonsense. Your presence steeled everyone's resolve.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: And that goal is?

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Down with the Empire! Surely peace will soon follow if the Empire is overthrown. Then my parents can finally find peace themselves.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Even with the church in shambles, we can still pray. The goddess will surely hear our prayers, but still... I hope the church can return to its former beauty someday.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Hey, Professor? I know that we didn't plan to stop at the monastery, but I'm glad we did. I'm happy to be here with everyone again.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're happy at a time like this?

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: What good does grimness do us? Let's try to enjoy our time together while we still can.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm happy too.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Right? It's as though we went back in time five years. I feel like my old self again.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: It's not just for my village that I'm fighting alongside you here, you know. It's also that Captain Jeralt asked me, his first and greatest apprentice, to look out for you. Of course, it wouldn't be enough just to keep you alive. It's my duty to make sure you win too. So, do your best, Professor. And count on me to watch your back.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: With the return of its knights, Garreg Mach is finally coming back to life. The Church of Seiros will follow you from now on, but please do not abandon the search for Lady Rhea.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll do whatever it takes to find her.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Thank you. I know the battles ahead will be dire, but we will support you with all our strength.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We don't know what the future will bring.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Wherever she is, Rhea is doubtlessly waiting for you. Please do not let her down.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Professor, I am so glad you are unharmed! No matter the path you walk, I will be with you every step of the way. Anything you ask of me, I shall see it through. You saved my life, and I am in your debt.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Thankfully, it appears the records and equipment I need for my research have not been damaged. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can talk about that.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Uh, maybe later...

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: My, Professor. You haven't changed a bit! At your age, I'd expect your while demeanor to have changed greatly over five years... Though, I suppose I haven't changed either right? Thank you for noticing, by the way. Ah, just the two of us, forever young. Oh, let me have my fun.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I'd given up on ever seeing you again. Where have you been hiding? Anyway, now that we're reunited in the land of the living, I must fulfill my promise!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What promise?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: The promise I made to the captain, to keep you safe! I can't believe you've forgotten. How cold...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Right, the promise.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: That's right! I promised the captain I'd protect you in his stead, and now I'll make good on my word!

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: In Lady Rhea's absence, I will follow you. That's what she would want me to do. Know that wherever you might lead us, I'll continue searching for Lady Rhea.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's fine.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: Good, because I will not budge on that point. Welcome back, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Sounds like a lot of trouble.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I don't care how much trouble it is! I will rescue Lady Rhea, at all costs.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I'm more of a mercenary than a knight these days. I work to get paid. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon... But I might change my mind if you're around.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: I don't know anything about rebuilding, but I can sure do my best to clean up the mess. I'm gonna keep Lady Rhea's room spotless, so she can use it right away whenever she gets back. You gotta find her, Professor. You just gotta.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! You know, it's such a thrill to be able to greet you like this again! I almost died in the battle five years ago, but I won't allow any enemies to get into this place again. I promise you that! even if the Death Knight shows up, I'll be sure to... Well, for now I'll keep training so I can eventually feel confident that I can stop him!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Your attention, everyone. The Knights of Seiros and our most trusted allies have gathered. We have rallied our troops for the purpose of stopping the Adrestian Empire's efforts to rule all. We have prepared a new flag to fight under...

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Much like the professor, it bears the Crest of Flames. I hope everyone finds this suitable. Beneath this flag, we will bring back peace to the great land of Fódlan!

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Professor, I'm not sure I understand... Why is the Empire intent on making an enemy of the church?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't understand either.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Quite perplexing... If the church disappears from Fódlan, I wonder if the Empire thinks it will benefit them in some way? I feel, I feel that it will only confuse the people.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: They must oppose the way of the church.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: What is meant by the way of the church? What do they dislike about it?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I have no idea what Edelgard was thinking or how she arrived at the decision to raise an army. However, I do have some small insight as to what she is after. She is attempting to destroy the existing social order. That is why the Church of Seiros is first on the list of institutions that must be destroyed. It may very well be her goal to rebuild Fódlan from the ground up...

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I see... But that is only Edelgard's desire, is it not? I cannot imagine that the people of Fódlan would want that for themselves. She may have high ideals, but she certainly lacks any compunction about throwing the world, and its people, into an awful war... It just seems so illogical!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: You have a point, Flayn. I do not believe the people will ever understand her aim. So long as she makes the people suffer, our Knights of Seiros will fight on and strive to protect them. If we do not defeat Edelgard and retake control of this world, Fódlan's future shall be as dark as night.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Thank you, dear Brother. I finally feel I understand what is going on.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I am always happy to answer your questions, Flayn. Is there anything else you wish to ask?

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Well, um... Actually, I have a question for the professor. My brother mentioned that...you slumbered for five years. Where was it that you slept?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: At the bottom of a valley.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: The bottom of a valley? In the water? That certainly sounds frigid! I would never choose such a place myself. I am surprised you did not fall ill.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Under a rock.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Under a rock... How similar we are! As it were, I took my rest in a casket made of stone.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Oh. Well, I suppose one's first long slumber is difficult to recall...

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: Pardon the intrusion, but we must prepare a counterattack! Now! It seems the Imperial Army found out about us entering the monastery!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Hm. That is sooner than expected. They must have been spying on us...

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: I wonder if we can win on our own...

intro.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
intro.line: There aren't many of them... It looks like we'll just be facing the ones who were stationed nearby.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Did they move on us too soon? Perhaps if we fight by using the land to our advantage...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's proceed carefully.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Of course. If we are careful, we will not lose.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's destroy them.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: Yes, I agree. Let us take them out in one fell swoop!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Never again will those Imperial scoundrels disgrace Garreg Mach with their presence! Onward, Professor!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: The Knights of Seiros are a powerful enemy, but we have more soldiers. We'll take them down all at once!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Clever tactics are our only hope here. We will use fire to deal with the main enemy force.

battle.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
battle.line: Report! The enemy has entered the periphery of Garreg Mach!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: If we allow them to take the interior, the monastery will be lost. We must drive them back!

battle.speaker: Imperial Soldier
battle.line: What? That strange battle flag is... But isn't our enemy the Church of Seiros?

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: They didn't have enough soldiers with just the church, so they upped their numbers by joining with those filthy rogues. It doesn't matter what flag they fly. They're nothing more than a mob. We'll destroy them all!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Our troops are preparing the attack. Protect them until they reach their destination!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Ugh... To think we'd let Garreg Mach fall twice to these rebels...

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: A total loss... But we can't just return home like this...

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Watch out, Professor! They're coming for you!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Our fire unit was destroyed. The plan has failed...

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: It looks like they were planning something, but it failed!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: All is prepared. Now we just need to draw the enemy's attention. Traitors! Repent of your sins and the goddess may yet show you mercy!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: Quiet! Don't think you'll get away with mocking me! Attack! Make sure they never speak again!

battle.speaker: Randolph
battle.line: Argh, a fire attack... The damage is too great. We can't fight anymore! All units, retreat! I'll take on our pursuers! Carry away the injured soldiers!

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Press the attack! Give them no quarter!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: We drove back the Imperial army. The real fight has only just begun...

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: I never thought I'd be fighting Randolph... I guess it can't be helped, seeing as how I've left my own territory and all. But...what will I do if my father or brother get involved. I really don't want to face them...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: We must stay strong.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Too true, Professor. So long as the Empire is our enemy, we cannot avoid fighting those we are acquainted with. Though I suppose I have it easier since my house is no longer on the Empire's side.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: My friends from the opera said they would leave the capital and go west... So, at least I won't be seeing them in battle.

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Hmm, I don't think I care if my own house falls. Let's make it a grand fight...after a grand nap of course...

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: It does not give me happiness to have the people of Brigid involved...but it is not the time to be thinking of that. If it is a possibility, I will be having their strength.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: I don't mind at all. Really! I have no friends anyway, and my father hasn't done much to make me care for him. Not that he'd ever step on a battlefield anyway! Oh, but I do wonder how Mother is doing...

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Each of our situations is unique. What we share is companionship and the will to fight as one. Professor, you are the heart of our efforts. We will support you as best we can.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I have a proposal. It would be most difficult to fight the Imperial army with the forces we have now. As such, I believe we should send messengers to whatever lords we can trust in the Kingdom and the Alliance so that we may gain their support. Do you agree?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I agree.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: It is heartening to hear you say that.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It concerns me.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: It is difficult to know who we can trust, of course. But we cannot just stand idle either.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: If all we do is bide our time, out enemy's main army will come down upon us like a hammer from above.

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: Who are you planning to ask?

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: Sadly, House Charon is out. We can trust them, but they have no help to offer.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Hm, how about House Daphnel of the Alliance? Their leader is sure to at least respond.

end.speaker: Flayn
end.line: Oh, how about House Daphnel of the Alliance? I recall that their leader was quite exceptional.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Judith, the Hero of Daphnel... Yes, that is a fine suggestion. That territory is on the border of the Kingdom and the Alliance. It has not yet been claimed by the fires of war. If they agree to lend us their troops, out forces will be greatly strengthened. We shall send along a secret messenger at once.
